content.question:
<math alttext="H C 2 H 3 O 2 aqueous plus H 2 O liquid is in equilibrium with H 3 O with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus C 2 H 3 O 2 with a negative 1 charge aqueous. p K sub a equals 4.76" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>) </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4.76</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
The equilibrium for the acid ionization of <math alttext="H C 2 H 3 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented by the equation above. A student wants to prepare a buffer with a <math alttext="p H " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="4.76" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.76</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> by combining <math alttext="25.00 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="0.30 molar H C 2 H 3 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="75.00 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>75.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="0.10 molar N a C 2 H 3 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>NaC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. While preparing the buffer, the student incorrectly measures the volume of <math alttext="N a C 2 H 3 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NaC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> so that the actual volume used is <math alttext="76.00 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>76.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> instead of <math alttext="75.00 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>75.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the error, which of the following is true about the buffer prepared by the student?

choices.label: The <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the buffer will be slightly lower than <math alttext="4.76" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.76</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because the total volume of the buffer is <math alttext="101.00 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>101.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> instead of <math alttext="100.00 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the <math alttext="H C 2 H 3 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> was diluted.

The <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the buffer will be slightly lower than <math alttext="4.76" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.76</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because the amount of <math alttext="C 2 H 3 O 2 with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> added was higher than the amount of <math alttext="H C 2 H 3 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> added.

The buffer solution will have a slightly higher capacity for the addition of bases than for the addition of acids because the total volume of the buffer is <math alttext="101.00 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>101.00</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> instead of <math alttext="100.00 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the <math alttext="H C 2 H 3 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> was diluted.

The buffer solution will have a slightly higher capacity for the addition of acids than for the addition of bases because the amount of <math alttext="C 2 H 3 O 2 with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> added was higher than the amount of <math alttext="H C 2 H 3 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> added.

content.answer: The buffer solution will have a slightly higher capacity for the addition of acids than for the addition of bases because the amount of <math alttext="C 2 H 3 O 2 with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> added was higher than the amount of <math alttext="H C 2 H 3 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> added.

skill.text: 6.G: Explain how potential sources of experimental error may affect the experimental results.
